Posts.Content: Kim_888 wrote: I wish everyone affected by breast cancer a very Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!  Enjoy making memories with your loved ones and don't let this disease steal your spirit.  Bless you all. Kim  Kim Dx 10/3/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/9 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A Holiday Wish Kim_888 EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2009 08:19PM Kim_888 wrote: Hi! I was on Avastin with Xeloda for 7 months last year.  I would only get the Avastin once every three weeks.  I would feel great after getting it.  After the third month, WHAM! my blood pressure went sky high (145/105).  The one good thing I always had was good BP readings, so this was a surprise.  I didn't feel anything, but the pressure was high enough to warrant going on BP medicine.   After we determined the Xeloda wasn't working, they took me off Avastin and I also went off the BP medicine.  My blood pressure returned to normal.  I was very leerie of taking the bp medicine because you hear about so many side effects, but I was on a low dose med, (Diovan 60) and it got my bp back in line.  I would take the medicine at night and didn't really notice any side effects.  Like I said, now I'm not on Avastin any more. I have just started Doxil and have been hoping for the best.  If your doc recommends going on BP medicine, don't fight it.   My GP explained to me that even with good diet and exercise, if your BP is being raised unnaturally due to the chemo med, trying to lower it naturally would be difficult. So, I went on the BP medicine rather than chance a stoke or worse.  I hope you get everything under control and best of luck with your treatment. Hope this info helps. take care, Kim
Posts.Title: Avastin and High Blood Pressure chrysanthemum chrysanthemum

Posts.Content: Kim_888 wrote: Well, its been over two years of the roller coaster ride from hell with constant changes in chemo and progression.  Finally, I'm seeing some positive results and have renewed hope that things are looking up.  I had restaging last week via PET/CT scans, labs, etc.  All results show the cancer has greatly diminished.  No evidence of disease or abnormalities in my right axilla or right neck!  Woo hoo.  The left axillary nodes that were previously seen on my Oct. studies have now diminished to within 'normal ranges'.   Although my tumor mass next to my sternum still 'persists' it has significantly diminished.   Overall, NO MORE PROGRESSION. I'm going to keep up with the Doxil and Zometa on a monthly basis, but the dosage has been reduced by 25%.  I hope and pray to God this trend continues. This news has made for a great start to 2010.  I'm hopeful that it will continue well into the year and beyond.   I pray that all of you receive good news, too.  Keep the faith!   Kim   Kim Dx 10/3/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/9 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Some Good News Kim_888 bourscheid

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2009 05:34AM Kim_888 wrote: I had my second Doxil treatment on 10/22.  My first treatment was 9/26.  I didn't notice anything at first, but after Day 10, my sternal swelling, chest redness, etc. diminished greatly.  I was very fatigued for days 10 through about 14, but then slowly started to regain my energy.   I had one bout of nausea after breakfast one morning, but that was it.  Since my second treatment, I've noticed my hands are getting a bit red--just ever slightly.  I had a terrible bout with hand and foot syndrome from Xeloda after about 4 months.  My doc and nurses have told me that I can probably expect it to happen again on Doxil, but hopefully not so bad. Otherwise, I don't really have any side effects yet to speak of.  I'm waiting for Day 10 to see if the fatigue kicks in, but truthfully, right now, I feel better than I have since July.  My pain is down considerably and I can actually sleep on my sides now and not just flat on my back.   Last week I even joined the local gym to start walking on the treadmill.  I feel peppier than I have in months. Something else I've been doing is starting to drink a lot of green tea.  I don't buy the sugary, bottle stuff.  I buy decaffienated green tea bags.  Fill my tea pot, bring to boil and add about 4-5 bags.  I let it steep and cool down then add it to a pitcher with some honey for sweetness.   I've always know green tea to be good for you, but I'm now drinking it daily.  I've also kicked up my diet with lots of veggies.  I don't get crazy with buying only organic, or fresh, etc.  I buy what is on sale, fresh or frozen and make sure I eat 3-4 servings for day. All in all, if I can get a good result from the Doxil, it doesn't seem to be so bad for now.  I can deal with only getting chemo and blood work, once per month as opposed to weekly when I was on taxotere.   Oh, and I get Zometa too to keep my bones strong and prevent chest fractures.  I'm going for new CT scans in about two weeks for restaging.  I'm anticipating some good news from this doxil.  Plus, maybe the green tea, the diet change and a little exercise is helping too. I hope you have a good result with Doxil.   Stay strong, be positive. Good luck, Kim
Posts.Title: Doxil Questions rdrake0 JeanneG

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2010 03:27AM Kim_888 wrote: Wow, I am humbled by all of your responses.  So many kind and supporting words.  THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU.  I wish all of you receive positive news, too and lots of wins for our team in 2010! I'm feeling strong.  I'm feeling positive.  This is a refreshing change from living in pain, worry, fear and anxiety for the last 2 yrs.   Something has changed inside of me--for the good!.  For the last two years, I've thought of my body and by cancer as two different entities.  The cancer, an unwanted squatter, living inside me with my body fighting to get rid of it.  As of now,  I feel like its packing its bags and moving out. This sounds weird, but its the only way I can describe it to my family.   Psychologically, I'm resolved to be rid of this disease - non negotiable.  I now feel a little more comfortable talking about the future and making some plans.     To PJB--I just received my 5th round of Doxil--been on it since late Sept.  HFS started to manifest with the 3rd cycle, but came on very strong by my 4th.  Dosage reduction was due to the SE's, along with improved scans.    Again, thank you all!  I'm feeling so pumped right now...LET'S KICK THE SH*T OUT OF THIS DISEASE!  (Fist Pump, Fist Pump, Fist Pump!)

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2010 08:38AM Kim_888 wrote: OMG....I am so sorry to hear this.  I don't post on here much, but Pat and I would exchange messages about every 2-3 weeks.  I was actually just checking in today to see if she messaged me.  My heart goes out to her family and friends.  At least now, her pain is over.   She will be missed greatly. Kim
Posts.Title: Wayover20 - Pat Alyson Kim_888

Posts.Content: Kim_888 wrote: "The day the Lord created hope was probably the same day he created Spring". ~Bern Williams  Spring has arrived in Pennsylvania. I'm thankful to be here, enjoying the beauty of this season. Today I learned that another friend has passed from this wicked disease. She's gone, but not forgotten. Her passing makes me cherish my days even more. Life is so precious, so finite. We are here one day and gone the next. I wish you all continued strength, hope, love and peace. Keep the faith and don't give up. Best wishes, Kim Kim Dx 10/3/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/9 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Spring Arrives Kim_888 bygracealone
